abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome rating of the
            Association for Strengthening Agricultural Research in
            Eastern and Central Africa (ASARECA) Multi-Donor Trust Fund
            was judged to be satisfactory. The Bank and borrower
            performance were satisfactory. The risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible. Significant changes included
            scaling up the Project to include 13 new sub-projects under
            Additional Financing (AF). The AF also financed to a lesser
            extent: (a) associated ASARECA monitoring and evaluation
            (M&E) activities; (b) ASARECA operational costs; and (c)
            a portion of Bank costs for continued grant oversight and
            administration. Several lessons were learned. First,
            agriculture research and development, especially field
            activities, requires sustained effort to be successful. Such
            an undertaking cannot be readily started, stopped and
            completed on a fixed timetable without compromising the
            results achieved. Second, it is important for research and
            dissemination to address the entire value chain rather than
            focusing on only specific segments. It is equally important
            that the policy landscape is not overlooked. Third, it is
            essential to ensure that information and knowledge flows are
            appropriate and up-to-date. Fourth, it is important to be
            proactive in identifying and selecting partners in research
            and dissemination endeavors to achieve desired outcomes.
            Fifth, to ensure sustainability of the regional agricultural
            research for development initiatives, sustainable and
            ensured source of funding is very important. Finally,
            research programs should work together to build on synergies
            and reap the corresponding benefits and not only have a
            commodity focus.
